algorithm.description: Which load balancing algorithm to use.

hash_on_header.description: The header to use for consistent-hashing.

latency_strategy.description: What metrics to use for latency. Available values are: `tpot` (time-per-output-token) and `e2e`.

retries.description: The number of retries to execute upon failure to proxy.

slots.description: The number of slots in the load balancer algorithm.

tokens_count_strategy.description: What tokens to use for usage calculation. Available values are: `total_tokens` `prompt_tokens`, and `completion_tokens`.

allow_override.description: If enabled, the authorization header or parameter can be overridden in the request by the value configured in the plugin.

aws_access_key_id.description:
Set this if you are using an AWS provider (Bedrock) and you are authenticating using static IAM User credentials. Setting this will override the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID environment variable for this plugin instance.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

aws_secret_access_key.description:
Set this if you are using an AWS provider (Bedrock) and you are authenticating using static IAM User credentials. Setting this will override the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY environment variable for this plugin instance.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

azure_client_id.description:
If azure_use_managed_identity is set to true, and you need to use a different user-assigned identity for this LLM instance, set the client ID.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

azure_client_secret.description:
If azure_use_managed_identity is set to true, and you need to use a different user-assigned identity for this LLM instance, set the client secret.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

azure_tenant_id.description:
If azure_use_managed_identity is set to true, and you need to use a different user-assigned identity for this LLM instance, set the tenant ID.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

azure_use_managed_identity.description: Set true to use the Azure Cloud Managed Identity (or user-assigned identity) to authenticate with Azure-provider models.

gcp_service_account_json.description:
Set this field to the full JSON of the GCP service account to authenticate, if required. If null (and gcp_use_service_account is true), Kong will attempt to read from environment variable `GCP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT`.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

gcp_use_service_account.description: Use service account auth for GCP-based providers and models.

header_name.description:
If AI model requires authentication via Authorization or API key header, specify its name here.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

header_value.description:
Specify the full auth header value for 'header_name', for example 'Bearer key' or just 'key'.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

param_location.description: Specify whether the 'param_name' and 'param_value' options go in a query string, or the POST form/JSON body.

param_name.description:
If AI model requires authentication via query parameter, specify its name here.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

param_value.description:
Specify the full parameter value for 'param_name'.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

provider.description: AI provider format to use for embeddings API

max_request_body_size.description: max allowed body size allowed to be introspected

model_name_header.description: Display the model name selected in the X-Kong-LLM-Model response header

allow_override.description: If enabled, the authorization header or parameter can be overridden in the request by the value configured in the plugin.

aws_access_key_id.description:
Set this if you are using an AWS provider (Bedrock) and you are authenticating using static IAM User credentials. Setting this will override the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID environment variable for this plugin instance.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

azure_use_managed_identity.description: Set true to use the Azure Cloud Managed Identity (or user-assigned identity) to authenticate with Azure-provider models.

gcp_service_account_json.description:
Set this field to the full JSON of the GCP service account to authenticate, if required. If null (and gcp_use_service_account is true), Kong will attempt to read from environment variable `GCP_SERVICE_ACCOUNT`.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

gcp_use_service_account.description: Use service account auth for GCP-based providers and models.

header_name.description:
If AI model requires authentication via Authorization or API key header, specify its name here.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

header_value.description:
Specify the full auth header value for 'header_name', for example 'Bearer key' or just 'key'.

This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).

param_location.description: Specify whether the 'param_name' and 'param_value' options go in a query string, or the POST form/JSON body.

param_name.description:
If AI model requires authentication via query parameter, specify its name here.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

description.description: The semantic description of the target, required if using semantic load balancing.

log_payloads.description: If enabled, will log the request and response body into the Kong log plugin(s) output.

log_statistics.description: If enabled and supported by the driver, will add model usage and token metrics into the Kong log plugin(s) output.

anthropic_version.description: Defines the schema/API version, if using Anthropic provider.

azure_deployment_id.description: Deployment ID for Azure OpenAI instances.

azure_instance.description: Instance name for Azure OpenAI hosted models.

aws_region.description: If using AWS providers (Bedrock) you can override the `AWS_REGION` environment variable by setting this option.

api_endpoint.description: If running Gemini on Vertex, specify the regional API endpoint (hostname only).

location_id.description: If running Gemini on Vertex, specify the location ID.

project_id.description: If running Gemini on Vertex, specify the project ID.

input_cost.description: Defines the cost per 1M tokens in your prompt.

llama2_format.description: If using llama2 provider, select the upstream message format.

max_tokens.description: Defines the max_tokens, if using chat or completion models.

mistral_format.description: If using mistral provider, select the upstream message format.

output_cost.description: Defines the cost per 1M tokens in the output of the AI.

temperature.description: Defines the matching temperature, if using chat or completion models.

top_k.description: Defines the top-k most likely tokens, if supported.

top_p.description: Defines the top-p probability mass, if supported.

upstream_path.description: Manually specify or override the AI operation path, used when e.g. using the 'preserve' route_type.

upstream_url.description: Manually specify or override the full URL to the AI operation endpoints, when calling (self-)hosted models, or for running via a private endpoint.

provider.description: AI provider request format - Kong translates requests to and from the specified backend compatible formats.

route_type.description: The model's operation implementation, for this provider. Set to `preserve` to pass through without transformation.

weight.description: The weight this target gets within the upstream loadbalancer (1-65535).

dimensions.description: the desired dimensionality for the vectors

distance_metric.description: the distance metric to use for vector searches

cluster_nodes.description: Cluster addresses to use for Redis connections when the `redis` strategy is defined. Defining this field implies using a Redis Cluster. The minimum length of the array is 1 element.

ip.description: A string representing a host name, such as example.com.

port.description: An integer representing a port number between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

connect_timeout.description: An integer representing a timeout in milliseconds. Must be between 0 and 2^31-2.

connection_is_proxied.description: If the connection to Redis is proxied (e.g. Envoy), set it `true`. Set the `host` and `port` to point to the proxy address.

database.description: Database to use for the Redis connection when using the `redis` strategy

host.description: A string representing a host name, such as example.com.

keepalive_backlog.description: Limits the total number of opened connections for a pool. If the connection pool is full, connection queues above the limit go into the backlog queue. If the backlog queue is full, subsequent connect operations fail and return `nil`. Queued operations (subject to set timeouts) resume once the number of connections in the pool is less than `keepalive_pool_size`. If latency is high or throughput is low, try increasing this value. Empirically, this value is larger than `keepalive_pool_size`.

keepalive_pool_size.description: The size limit for every cosocket connection pool associated with every remote server, per worker process. If neither `keepalive_pool_size` nor `keepalive_backlog` is specified, no pool is created. If `keepalive_pool_size` isn't specified but `keepalive_backlog` is specified, then the pool uses the default value. Try to increase (e.g. 512) this value if latency is high or throughput is low.

password.description:
Password to use for Redis connections. If undefined, no AUTH commands are sent to Redis.
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

port.description: An integer representing a port number between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

read_timeout.description: An integer representing a timeout in milliseconds. Must be between 0 and 2^31-2.

send_timeout.description: An integer representing a timeout in milliseconds. Must be between 0 and 2^31-2.

sentinel_master.description: Sentinel master to use for Redis connections. Defining this value implies using Redis Sentinel.

sentinel_nodes.description: Sentinel node addresses to use for Redis connections when the `redis` strategy is defined. Defining this field implies using a Redis Sentinel. The minimum length of the array is 1 element.

host.description: A string representing a host name, such as example.com.

port.description: An integer representing a port number between 0 and 65535, inclusive.

sentinel_password.description:
Sentinel password to authenticate with a Redis Sentinel instance. If undefined, no AUTH commands are sent to Redis Sentinels.
This field is [encrypted](/gateway/keyring/).
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

sentinel_role.description: Sentinel role to use for Redis connections when the `redis` strategy is defined. Defining this value implies using Redis Sentinel.

sentinel_username.description:
Sentinel username to authenticate with a Redis Sentinel instance. If undefined, ACL authentication won't be performed. This requires Redis v6.2.0+.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

server_name.description: A string representing an SNI (server name indication) value for TLS.

ssl.description: If set to true, uses SSL to connect to Redis.

ssl_verify.description: If set to true, verifies the validity of the server SSL certificate. If setting this parameter, also configure `lua_ssl_trusted_certificate` in `kong.conf` to specify the CA (or server) certificate used by your Redis server. You may also need to configure `lua_ssl_verify_depth` accordingly.

username.description:
Username to use for Redis connections. If undefined, ACL authentication won't be performed. This requires Redis v6.0.0+. To be compatible with Redis v5.x.y, you can set it to `default`.
This field is [referenceable](/gateway/entities/vault/#how-do-i-reference-secrets-stored-in-a-vault).

strategy.description: which vector database driver to use

threshold.description: the default similarity threshold for accepting semantic search results (float)

consumer.description: If set, the plugin will activate only for requests where the specified has been authenticated. (Note that some plugins can not be restricted to consumers this way.). Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the authenticated Consumer.

consumer_group.description: If set, the plugin will activate only for requests where the specified consumer group has been authenticated. (Note that some plugins can not be restricted to consumers groups this way.). Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the authenticated Consumer Groups

protocols.description: A set of strings representing HTTP protocols.

route.description: If set, the plugin will only activate when receiving requests via the specified route. Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the route being used.

service.description: If set, the plugin will only activate when receiving requests via one of the routes belonging to the specified Service. Leave unset for the plugin to activate regardless of the Service being matched.
